decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with instants and sorceries to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard, leveraging other spells like Crackling Drake and Snapcaster Mage for additional value. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Surgical Extraction and Thing in the Ice to control the opponent's board while maintaining pressure. The use of cantrips like Serum Visions and Faithless Looting help ensure a consistent flow of spells, while Pyromancer Ascension can provide additional power for explosive turns. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive threats and efficient card selection.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on efficient removal, disruptive hand disruption, and strong creatures to apply pressure on the opponent. With cards like Tarmogoyf, Dark Confidant, and Scavenging Ooze, the deck aims to establish board presence quickly while controlling the opponent's resources with cards like Thoughtseize and Liliana of the Veil. Additionally, the deck includes versatile removal spells like Assassin's Trophy and Fatal Push to deal with opposing threats. This deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of proactive threats and disruptive spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of discard spells, removal spells, and efficient creatures to apply pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By using cards like Thoughtseize, Fatal Push, and Tarmogoyf, along with planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope, the deck aims to control the board and grind out wins through attrition. The inclusion of cards like Tireless Tracker and Kalitas, Traitor of Ghet provide additional value and threat diversity, allowing the deck to adapt to various matchups and strategies.

The main idea of this Modern 1 vs 1 deck is to efficiently utilize Amulet of Vigor to allow multiple land drops in a turn, enabling explosive ramp with cards like Primeval Titan and Azusa, Lost but Seeking. The deck focuses on quickly assembling the powerful Amulet Titan combo, using synergies between lands like Simic Growth Chamber and bounce lands to generate huge amounts of mana and overwhelm opponents with large threats. Support cards like Ancient Stirrings and Coalition Relic help find key pieces of the combo, while disruption in the form of Engineered Explosives and Pact of Negation protects the game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to use cards that allow the player to discard cards from their deck, enabling them to bring back powerful creatures from the graveyard while also dealing damage to the opponent. By repeatedly discarding and dredging, the player can quickly fill their graveyard with creatures like Prized Amalgam and Narcomoeba, as well as deal damage with cards like Creeping Chill. This deck focuses on utilizing the graveyard as a resource to fuel its combo strategy and overwhelm the opponent with a fast and relentless assault.

The deck aims to quickly assemble the Amulet of Vigor and Primeval Titan combo to generate a significant amount of mana and fetch powerful lands from the deck. Cards like Azusa, Lost but Seeking and Sakura-Tribe Scout help ramp up lands onto the battlefield, while Coalition Relic and Ancient Stirrings provide additional support for the combo. The deck also includes utility lands like Bojuka Bog and Ghost Quarter for disruption and protection. Overall, the main focus is to execute the combo efficiently and overwhelm the opponent with powerful land and creature plays.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize discard effects and cheap creatures to quickly fill up the graveyard and create an aggressive board presence. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures like Hollow One and Flameblade Adept, as well as recurring threats like Bloodghast and Flamewake Phoenix. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt to control the board and clear a path for the aggro creatures to attack for victory.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying Arclight Phoenix onto the battlefield by effectively cycling through spells such as Serum Visions, Faithless Looting, and Thought Scour. Utilizing cards like Pyromancer Ascension and Manamorphose to generate additional value, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with aggressive creatures like Thing in the Ice and Crackling Drake. In addition, cards like Snapcaster Mage and Surgical Extraction provide utility and disruption. The deck is built around efficiency and speed, aiming to close out games quickly through powerful spell interactions and explosive creatures.

The main goal of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Mine) to generate a large amount of mana and cast powerful threats such as Wurmcoil Engine, Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, and Karn Liberated. This deck aims to control the game by using removal spells like Oblivion Stone and Thought-Knot Seer, while also disrupting the opponent's graveyard with Relic of Progenitus. Additionally, the deck utilizes card draw and tutoring abilities with Chromatic Star, Chromatic Sphere, Expedition Map, and Ancient Stirrings to ensure consistency in finding its key pieces.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly reduce their life total to zero. By playing efficient creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear alongside powerful burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Boros Charm, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. Cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Skullcrack help prevent the opponent from gaining life or stabilizing, ensuring your aggro strategy can close out the game before the opponent can mount a defense.

The deck utilizes a variety of creature toolbox cards, combined with cards that allow for quick and consistent tutoring and card advantage. It aims to assemble combos involving cards like Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies to generate infinite mana or persist/undying loops for a strong board presence. The deck also includes utility creatures like Kitchen Finks and Eternal Witness to provide resilience and flexibility in different matchups. Additionally, Collected Company and Chord of Calling allow for quick access to key creatures, while a small amount of disruption helps control the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on creating a fast and aggressive board presence by utilizing a variety of Human creatures with disruptive abilities. By utilizing cards like Aether Vial and Cavern of Souls to cheat out creatures, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of evasion, tempo disruption, and buffs from cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish. This allows the deck to pressure the opponent early in the game and maintain pressure throughout, making it difficult for the opponent to stabilize or mount a comeback.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble a lethal combination of cards to deal 10 poison counters to your opponent, thereby winning the game. This involves using cards like Blighted Agent, Glistener Elf, and Inkmoth Nexus to quickly deal infect damage, while using pump spells like Might of Old Krosa and Mutagenic Growth to increase the power and toughness of your creatures. Protection is also key, with cards like Blossoming Defense and Vines of Vastwood keeping your creatures safe from removal spells. The deck aims to fast and efficiently overwhelm your opponent with infect damage before they can stabilize.

This deck focuses on using artifacts to control the game, with cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Chalice of the Void to disrupt opponent's strategies. It also utilizes cards like Engineered Explosives and Sorcerous Spyglass for additional control and disruption. The deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly using cards like Whir of Invention and Ancient Stirrings, while also protecting itself with Welding Jar and Witchbane Orb. The inclusion of Tormod's Crypt and Grafdigger's Cage allows the deck to interact with graveyard strategies, making it a versatile and powerful control archetype in the Modern format.

This deck aims to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant) to generate huge amounts of mana and cast powerful threats like Wurmcoil Engine, Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, and Karn Liberated to control the game. It also includes color fixing artifacts like Chromatic Sphere and Chromatic Star, ways to find the Tron lands quickly like Expedition Map and Sylvan Scrying, and graveyard hate with Relic of Progenitus. The deck also includes removal options like Oblivion Stone and Ghost Quarter to disrupt the opponent's strategy.

This UW Control deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. By utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, alongside efficient removal spells like Path to Exile and Terminus, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and disrupt their game plan. With a solid mana base and access to powerful card draw spells like Opt and Hieroglyphic Illumination, the deck can consistently find the right answers to keep the opponent in check and ultimately secure the win.

The deck aims to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card draw until it can stabilize and win the game with powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. Using cards like Terminus and Path to Exile for creature removal, alongside counterspells like Cryptic Command and Negate, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its own win conditions. The land base is designed to support the control strategy, with utility lands like Field of Ruin and Celestial Colonnade providing additional flexibility and late-game power.
